meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being servile.
meanings.sent1: Her constant servilities towards her boss made her colleagues uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The servilities of the butler were evident in his deferential manner.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerated servilities of the waiter amused the customers.
meanings.sent4: The servilities of the sycophant knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The servilities of the character in the play were portrayed with great detail.

meanings.definition: An act or expression of servility.
meanings.sent1: He performed servilities to gain favor with the king.
meanings.sent2: The servilities of the courtiers were met with disdain by the queen.
meanings.sent3: The servilities of the dog begging for treats were endearing.
meanings.sent4: Her servilities were like a mask she wore to hide her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The servilities of the politician were seen through by the public.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of a servant.
meanings.sent1: The servilities of the maid were appreciated by the household.
meanings.sent2: His servilities in carrying out his duties were commendable.
meanings.sent3: The servilities of the robot butler malfunctioned, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her servilities in serving the guests were impeccable.
meanings.sent5: The servilities of the servant reflected his dedication to his job.
